Token.Abstract: The file object represents a particular file at a particular version. It has basic file operations such as reading and writing the file's contents and getting info about the file. It can also tell you the current sync status, whether there's a newer version available, and allows you to update to the newer version.
Returns a read-only file handle for the file. If the file is not cached then the method will block until the file is downloaded.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A file handle if the file can be read, or nil if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: A wrapper for readHandle: that reads the entire file contents into an NSData object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The file's contents if the file can be read, or nil if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: A wrapper for readHandle: that reads the entire file contents as a UTF8 encoded string.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The file's contents decoded as UTF8 if the file can be read, or nil if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Updates the file's contents with the contents of the file at localPath.

Parameter.Name: shouldSteal
Parameter.Abstract: whether the file at localPath should be moved from its current location (i.e. "stolen") into management by the Sync SDK, or if it must be copied. If you are done with the file at localPath, then stealing is more efficient, but the behavior of writing to the file after stealing is undefined. Stealing will fail if the source file is not on the same device as the SDK cache, since it relies on the ability to rename without copying.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the file was written successfully, or NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Updates the contents of the file to be the bytes stored in data.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the file was written successfully, or NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Updates the contents of the file with the parameter string encoded in UTF8.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the file was written successfully, or NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Apppends the data supplied to the end of the file. If the file is not cached, then the method will block until the file is downloaded.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the data was appended to the file successfully, or NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Appends the UTF8 encoded string to the file. If the file is not cached, then the method will block until the file is downloaded.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the string was appended to the file successfully, or NO if an error occured.

Token.Abstract: If there is a newer version of the file available, and it's cached (determined by the cached property on newerStatus, then this method will update the file object to reference the newer version so it can be read from or written to.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the file was written successfully, or NO if an error occurred.

Token.Abstract: Closes the file, preventing any further operations to occur and allowing the file to be opened again. This happens automatically when the object is deallocated.
The DBFileInfo for the file.
The DBFileInfo for the file.
Whether the file is currently open.
Whether the file is currently open.
The current sync status for the file or thumbnail version represented by this DBFile.
The current sync status for the file or thumbnail version represented by this DBFile.
The current sync status for the newer version of the file. If the file is the newest version, then this property is nil.
The current sync status for the newer version of the file. If the file is the newest version, then this property is nil.
Whether this DBFile represents a thumbnail, rather than the file contents.
Whether this DBFile represents a thumbnail, rather than the file contents.
Add block as an observer when a property of the file changes.
Remove all blocks registered for the given observer.
